protocol_name: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
protocol_name_html: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
description:
This protocol is for the NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing Kit v2, designed to prepare small RNA libraries for sequencing using Illumina® sequencers. This kit utilizes adapters with randomized ends to greatly reduce sequence bias in small RNA sequencing library construction.

Please see the full manual for additional details.

(The protocol below describes preparation of small RNA sequencing libraries from Total RNA starting material; for  small RNA samples, please see this protocol.)
warning:
Bioo Scientific strongly recommends that you read the following warnings and precautions. Periodically, optimizations and revisions are made to the components and manual. Therefore, it is important to follow the protocol included with the kit. If you need further assistance, you may contact your local distributor or Bioo Scientific at nextgen@biooscientific.com.
• Do not use the kit past the expiration date.
• This kit contains a single Barcoded Primer. To enable multiplexing, please use the appopriate combination of NEXTflex™ Small RNA Barcodes during the PCR Amplification step.
• Try to maintain a laboratory temperature of 20°–25°C (68°–77°F).
• RNA sample quality may vary between preparations. It is the user’s responsibility to optimize the initial RNA input amount to obtain desired PCR bands for gel excision and sequencing. Refer to the Starting Material section for additional information.
• Vortex and micro centrifuge each component prior to use, to ensure material has not lodged in the cap or the side of the tube.
• Do not remove AIR Ligase or T4 RNA Ligase 1 enzymes from -20°C until immediately before use and return to -20°C immediately after use.
• Some total RNA extraction and purification methods may not efficiently isolate small RNAs. Users should verify that their extraction and purification method also isolates small RNAs.
guidelines:
Contents, Storage and Shelf Life
The NEXTflexÃ¢ÂÂ¢ Small RNA Sequencing Kit v2 contains enough material to prepare 24 RNA samples for IlluminaÃÂ® compatible next-generation sequencing. The shelf life of all reagents is 6 months when stored properly. All components can safely be stored at -20ÃÂ°C, except: Adapter Depletion Solution, Resuspension Buffer, Nuclease-free Water, and Elution Buffer, which can be stored at room temperature.



*see Reagent Preparation for dilution procedure

Required Materials Not Provided
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 1-10 ÃÂµg total RNA or purified small RNA from 1-10 ÃÂµg total RNA in up to 4 ÃÂµL Nucleasefree Water
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Isopropanol
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 80% Ethanol
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 2, 10, 20, 200 and 1000 ÃÂµL pipettes
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ RNase-free pipette tips
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Microcentrifuge
Ã¢ÂÂ¢Nuclease-free 1.7 mL microcentrifuge tubes
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 96 well PCR Plate Non-skirted (Phenix Research, Cat # MPS-499) or similar
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Sterile disposable pestles (Fisher Cat # K749521-1500 or similar)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Thin wall nuclease-free PCR tubes
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Thermocycler
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Heat block
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 6% TBE PAGE gels (1.0 mm) (Life Technologies Cat # EC6265BOX)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 1X TBE buffer
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Clean razor or scalpel
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Nucleic acid stain such as SYBR Gold (Invitrogen)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ UV transilluminator or gel documentation instrument
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Gel Electrophoresis apparatus
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Electrophoresis power supply
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Vortex
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 0.45ÃÂµm, 2 mL Spin-X Centrifuge tube (Sigma Cat # CLS8162)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Agencourt AMPure XP 60 mL (Beckman Coulter Genomics, Cat # A63881)
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Magnetic Stand -96 (Ambion, Cat # AM10027) or similar
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Magnetic stand for micrcentrifuge tubes (Life Technologies DynaMagÃ¢ÂÂ¢-2 or similar)

Optional Materials Not Provided
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ÃÂ If multiplexing: NEXTflexÃ¢ÂÂ¢ Small RNA Barcodes A Ã¢ÂÂ D (513305, 513306, 513307, 513308)

NEXTflexÃ¢ÂÂ¢ Small RNA Sample Preparation Flow Chart


Starting Material
The NEXTflexÃ¢ÂÂ¢ Small RNA Sequencing Kit v2 has been optimized and validated using total RNA (1 - 10 ÃÂµg), purified small RNA (from 1 - 10 ÃÂµg total RNA), and a synthetic miRNA pool (Ã¢ÂÂ¥100 pg). Best results are obtained with high quality starting material. The use of degraded RNA may result in poor yields or lack of sequencing output data. Bioo Scientific recommends running total RNA on a 1 - 2% agarose gel or examining its integrity using an Agilent Bioanalyzer. High quality total RNA preparations should have an 28S band that is twice as intense as the 18S band of ribosomal RNA. At low concentrations, small RNA is difficult to detect on a gel; however it can be detected using an Agilent Bioanalyzer Small RNA assay (see Figure 2 in Appendix A). We recommend beginning with total RNA or a preparation of highly enriched small RNA by PAGE selecting small RNAs around 15-45 nt long or using a phenol-based small RNA isolation method such as BiooPureÃ¢ÂÂ¢ (Cat # 5301) for enrichment.

If the user is performing the procedure for the first time, we recommend using the microRNA Control included in the kit: 5Ã¢ÂÂPhos/CUCAGGAUGGCGGAGCGGUCU/3Ã¢ÂÂ. This positive control sample consists of 21 RNA nucleotides and does not match any known sequence in miRBase. When running a positive control reaction, the user should add 1 ÃÂµL of the microRNA Control in STEP A instead of their small RNA sample and expect to observe a 147 nt PCR product. The microRNA control may degrade with multiple freeze thaw cycles or exposure to nucleases. If you plan on using the control multiple times, we recommend aliquoting into several tubes and storing at -20ÃÂ°C. For a total RNA positive control, human brain total RNA (Ambion catalog number AM7962 or similar) is recommended.

Reagent Preparation
1. Vortex and micro centrifuge each component prior to use, to ensure material has not lodged in the cap or the side of the tube.
2. Add 18 mL of molecular biology-grade water to each bottle of Elution Buffer (10X) to make a 1X Elution Buffer. Check box on bottle to show water has been added.

Small RNA Starting Material
1. Add 10 ÃÂµL of Nuclease-free Water to each sample and mix well by pipette.
2. Add 6 ÃÂµL of Adapter Depletion Solution and mix well by pipette.
3. Add 40 ÃÂµL of AMPure XP beads and 60 ÃÂµL of ispropanol and mix well by pipette.
4. Incubate for 5 minutes.
5. Magnetize sample until solution appears clear.
6. Remove and discard supernatant.
7. Add 180 ÃÂµL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol, incubate for 30 seconds, and remove with a P200 or P300 set to 200 ÃÂµL. Repeat this step for a total of 2 ethanol washes. IMPORTANT: Always use freshly prepared 80% ethanol and do not incubate the bead pellet with 80% ethanol for extended periods.
8. Incubate sample for 3 minutes. After one minute, remove all residual liquid that may have collected at the bottom of the well.
9. Remove plate from magnetic stand and resuspend bead pellet in 22 ÃÂµL of Resuspenion Buffer by pipetting volume up and down. Ensure that beads are completely resuspended.
10. Incubate 2 minutes. During incubation, add 6 ÃÂµL of Adapter Depletion Solution to a new, empty well.
11. Magnetize sample until solution appears clear.
12. Transfer 20 ÃÂµL of supernatant to a new well containing 6 ÃÂµL Adapter Depletion Solution and mix well by pipette.
13. Add 40 ÃÂµL of AMPure XP beads and 60 ÃÂµL of ispropanol and mix well by pipette.
14. Incubate for 5 minutes.
15. Magnetize sample until solution appears clear.
16. Remove and discard supernatant.
17. Add 180 ÃÂµL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol, incubate for 30 seconds, and remove with a P200 or P300 set to 200 ÃÂµL. Repeat this step for a total of 2 ethanol washes. IMPORTANT: Always use freshly prepared 80% ethanol and do not incubate the bead pellet with 80% ethanol for extended periods.
18. Incubate sample for 3 minutes. After one minute, remove any residual liquid that may have collected at the bottom of the well.
19. Remove plate from magnetic stand and resuspend bead pellet in 12 ÃÂµL of Nuclease-free Water by pipetting. Ensure that beads are completely resuspended.
20. Incubate for 2 minutes.
21. Magnetize until solution appears clear.
22. Transfer 11 ÃÂµL of supernatant to a new well. Proceed to Step C: 5Ã¢ÂÂ NEXTflexÃ¢ÂÂ¢ 4N Adapter Ligation.

Figure 2
6% TBE-PAGE gel
A. PCR product from library constructed from 1 ÃÂµg human brain total RNA
B. Ready to Load Low MW Ladder
C. PCR product from library constructed from 1 ÃÂµL miRNA control
NOTE: 25 bp band not shown. 225 bp & 250 bp bands may run as a single band.

References
Jayaprakash et al. Identification and remediation of biases in the activity of RNA ligases in small-RNA deep sequencing. Nucl. Acids Res. (2011) 39 (21):e141

source_data.annotation:
Materials for "NEXTflex™ 4N Adenylated Adapter Ligation" section.

Bioo Scientific Supplied
RED CAP - 3’ NEXTflex™ 4N Adenylated Adapter, AIR™ Ligase, 50% PEG, NEXTflex™ RNase Inhibitor
WHITE CAP - Nuclease-free Water

User Supplied
RNA (1-10 µg total RNA or small RNA isolated from total RNA) in 4 µL Nuclease-free Water
96 well PCR plate
Thermocycler
Ice

components.data:
For each reaction combine the following in a 96 well PCR plate:

4 µL RNA (in Nuclease-free Water)
1 µL 3’ NEXTflex™ 4N Adenylated Adapter
components.name: Description

components.data:
Add the following components to each well and mix well:

1 µL AIR™ Ligase
1 µL AIR™ Ligase Buffer
2.5 µL 50% PEG (Note: 50% PEG is very viscous, please pipette carefully)
0.5 µL RNase Inhibitor

Ice

components.data:
For each reaction, combine the following components in a well of a 96-well PCR plate and mix thoroughly:

12.5 µL 3’ NEXTflex™ 4N Adapter Ligated RNA & 5’ NEXTflex™ 4N Adapter
1.5 µL AIR™ Ligase Buffer
1.5 µL ATP
1.5 µL T4 RNA Ligase 1
3.5 µL 50% PEG (Note: 50% PEG is very viscous, please pipette carefully)
0.5 µL RNase Inhibitor
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
For each reaction, combine the following components in a well of a 96-well PCR plate and mix thoroughly:

12.5 µL 3’ NEXTflex™ 4N Adapter Ligated RNA & 5’ NEXTflex™ 4N Adapter
1.5 µL AIR™ Ligase Buffer
1.5 µL ATP
1.5 µL T4 RNA Ligase 1
3.5 µL 50% PEG (Note: 50% PEG is very viscous, please pipette carefully)
0.5 µL RNase Inhibitor

components.name: Description

4 µL 10X M-MuLV Buffer
4 µL dNTPs
8 µL Nuclease-free Water
2 µL M-MuLV Reverse Transcriptase
components.name: Description

4 µL dNTPs
8 µL Nuclease-free Water
2 µL M-MuLV Reverse Transcriptase

components.data: Incubate in a thermocycler at 44°C for 1 hour followed by 90°C for 10 minutes. The procedure may be safely stopped at this step and samples stored at -20°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate in a thermocycler at 44°C for 1 hour followed by 90°C for 10 minutes. The procedure may be safely stopped at this step and samples stored at -20°C.

components.data: Add 10 µL of Adapter Depletion Solution to each sample and mix well by pipette
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 10 µL of Adapter Depletion Solution to each sample and mix well by pipette

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 42 of NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.annotation:
Materials for section "Bead Cleanup"

Bioo Scientific Supplied
RED CAP - Adapter Depletion Solution

User Supplied
Agencourt AMPure XP Magnetic Beads (room temperature)
Isopropanol
80% Ethanol, freshly prepared
Magnetic Stand
*40 µL of First Strand Synthesis product (from section "Reverse Transcription-First Strand Synthesis")
source_data.thread_text:

Bioo Scientific Supplied
RED CAP - Adapter Depletion Solution

User Supplied
Agencourt AMPure XP Magnetic Beads (room temperature)
Isopropanol
80% Ethanol, freshly prepared

source_data.body:
Materials for section "Bead Cleanup"

Bioo Scientific Supplied
RED CAP - Adapter Depletion Solution

User Supplied
Agencourt AMPure XP Magnetic Beads (room temperature)
Isopropanol
80% Ethanol, freshly prepared
Magnetic Stand
*40 µL of First Strand Synthesis product (from section "Reverse Transcription-First Strand Synthesis")

components.data: Add 40 µL of AMPure XP beads and 90 µL of ispropanol and mix well by pipette.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 40 µL of AMPure XP beads and 90 µL of ispropanol and mix well by pipette.
Incubate for 5 minutes.

components.data: Magnetize sample until solution is clear.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Magnetize sample until solution is clear.
Remove and discard supernatant.

components.data: Wash #1: Add 180 µL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol, incubate for 30 seconds, and remove with a P200 or P300 set to 200 µL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #1: Add 180 µL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol, incubate for 30 seconds, and remove with a P200 or P300 set to 200 µL.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 47 of NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.annotation: IMPORTANT: Always use freshly prepared 80% ethanol and do not incubate the bead pellet with 80% ethanol for extended periods.
source_data.thread_text: IMPORTANT: Always use freshly prepared 80% ethanol and do not incubate the bead pellet with 80% ethanol for extended periods.
source_data.body: IMPORTANT: Always use freshly prepared 80% ethanol and do not incubate the bead pellet with 80% ethanol for extended periods.

components.data: Wash #2: Add 180 µL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol, incubate for 30 seconds, and remove with a P200 or P300 set to 200 µL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #2: Add 180 µL of freshly prepared 80% ethanol, incubate for 30 seconds, and remove with a P200 or P300 set to 200 µL.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 48 of NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.annotation: IMPORTANT: Always use freshly prepared 80% ethanol and do not incubate the bead pellet with 80% ethanol for extended periods.
source_data.thread_text: IMPORTANT: Always use freshly prepared 80% ethanol and do not incubate the bead pellet with 80% ethanol for extended periods.
source_data.body: IMPORTANT: Always use freshly prepared 80% ethanol and do not incubate the bead pellet with 80% ethanol for extended periods.

components.data:
Incubate sample for 3 minutes. After one minute, remove any residual liquid that may
have collected at the bottom of the well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Incubate sample for 3 minutes. After one minute, remove any residual liquid that may
have collected at the bottom of the well.

components.data:
Remove plate from magnetic stand and resuspend bead pellet in 19 µL of Nuclease-free
Water by pipetting. Ensure that beads are completely resuspended.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove plate from magnetic stand and resuspend bead pellet in 19 µL of Nuclease-free
Water by pipetting. Ensure that beads are completely resuspended.
Incubate for 2 minutes.
Magnetize until solution is clear.

components.data: Transfer 18 µL of supernatant to a new well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer 18 µL of supernatant to a new well.

components.data:
For each PCR reaction add the following to the 18 µL purified First Strand Synthesis product (from section "Bead Cleanup"):

5 µL 5X DuroTaq Master Mix
1 µL NEXTflex™ Barcode Primer 1 or Barcoded Primer from NEXTflex™ Small RNA Barcodes Kit
1 µL NEXTflex™ Universal Primer
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
For each PCR reaction add the following to the 18 µL purified First Strand Synthesis product (from section "Bead Cleanup"):

5 µL 5X DuroTaq Master Mix
1 µL NEXTflex™ Barcode Primer 1 or Barcoded Primer from NEXTflex™ Small RNA Barcodes Kit
1 µL NEXTflex™ Universal Primer

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 54 of NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.annotation:
Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
GREEN CAP - NEXTflex™ Barcode Primer 1, NEXTflex™ Universal Primer, 5X DuroTaq Master Mix

User Supplied
(Optional) NEXTflex™ Barcode Primer (NEXTflex™ Small RNA Barcodes: 513305, 513306, 513307, or 513308)
Thermocycler
*18 µL Purified First Strand Synthesis product (from section "Bead Cleanup")
source_data.thread_text:

User Supplied
(Optional) NEXTflex™ Barcode Primer (NEXTflex™ Small RNA Barcodes: 513305, 513306, 513307, or 513308)
Thermocycler

Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
GREEN CAP - NEXTflex™ Barcode Primer 1, NEXTflex™ Universal Primer, 5X DuroTaq Master Mix

User Supplied
(Optional) NEXTflex™ Barcode Primer (NEXTflex™ Small RNA Barcodes: 513305, 513306, 513307, or 513308)
Thermocycler
*18 µL Purified First Strand Synthesis product (from section "Bead Cleanup")

components.data: Cycle as follows: (Make sure thermocycler is above 80°C before placing samples on block)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cycle as follows: (Make sure thermocycler is above 80°C before placing samples on block)

components.data: Add 5 µL of 6X Gel Loading Dye to each PCR product and mix well
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5 µL of 6X Gel Loading Dye to each PCR product and mix well

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 56 of NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.annotation:
Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
ORANGE CAP - 6X Gel Loading Dye, Ready to Load Low MW Ladder

User Supplied
6% TBE-PAGE Gel
1X TBE Buffer
Nucleic acid stain such as SYBR Gold (Invitrogen)
UV transilluminator or other visualization tool
Clean razor or scalpel
Nuclease-free 1.7 mL microcentrifuge tube
*PCR Product (25 µL) (from section "PCR Amplification")
source_data.thread_text:
Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
ORANGE CAP - 6X Gel Loading Dye, Ready to Load Low MW Ladder

User Supplied
6% TBE-PAGE Gel
1X TBE Buffer
Nucleic acid stain such as SYBR Gold (Invitrogen)
UV transilluminator or other visualization tool
Clean razor or scalpel
Nuclease-free 1.7 mL microcentrifuge tube
*PCR Product (25 µL) (from section "PCR Amplification")
source_data.body:
Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
ORANGE CAP - 6X Gel Loading Dye, Ready to Load Low MW Ladder

User Supplied
6% TBE-PAGE Gel
1X TBE Buffer
Nucleic acid stain such as SYBR Gold (Invitrogen)
UV transilluminator or other visualization tool
Clean razor or scalpel
Nuclease-free 1.7 mL microcentrifuge tube
*PCR Product (25 µL) (from section "PCR Amplification")

components.data: Load purified PCR products onto a 6% TBE-PAGE gel. We recommend leaving 1-2 lanes between samples prepared with the same barcode primer to avoid cross contamination. Samples prepared with different barcodes and that will be sequenced together may be run in adjacent lanes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Load purified PCR products onto a 6% TBE-PAGE gel. We recommend leaving 1-2 lanes between samples prepared with the same barcode primer to avoid cross contamination. Samples prepared with different barcodes and that will be sequenced together may be run in adjacent lanes.

components.data: In an adjacent lane load 10 µL of Ready to Load Low MW Ladder.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: In an adjacent lane load 10 µL of Ready to Load Low MW Ladder.

components.data: Run the gel with 1X TBE buffer at 200 V until the lower dye band is near the bottom of the gel (0.5-1 cm). The gel should run for approximately 30 minutes. Run times may vary depending on individual equipment.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run the gel with 1X TBE buffer at 200 V until the lower dye band is near the bottom of the gel (0.5-1 cm). The gel should run for approximately 30 minutes. Run times may vary depending on individual equipment.

components.data: Carefully remove the gel from the glass plates and stain with a nucleic acid stain such as SYBR Gold (Invitrogen) per manufacturer instructions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully remove the gel from the glass plates and stain with a nucleic acid stain such as SYBR Gold (Invitrogen) per manufacturer instructions.

components.data: Visualize gel bands on a UV transilluminator or other gel documentation instrument.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Visualize gel bands on a UV transilluminator or other gel documentation instrument.

components.data: Using a clean razor cut out the ~150 bp band and place into clean 1.7 mL tube. Do not cut out the ~130 bp band; this is adapter dimer product. See Figure 2 in Guidelines for example. The ladder band at 200 bp is twice as intense as the other bands and can be used for orientation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using a clean razor cut out the ~150 bp band and place into clean 1.7 mL tube. Do not cut out the ~130 bp band; this is adapter dimer product. See Figure 2 in Guidelines for example. The ladder band at 200 bp is twice as intense as the other bands and can be used for orientation.

components.data: Briefly centrifuge the microcentrifuge tube containing the gel slice to collect the gel slice at the bottom of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Briefly centrifuge the microcentrifuge tube containing the gel slice to collect the gel slice at the bottom of the tube.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 63 of NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.annotation:
Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
YELLOW CAP - Resuspension Buffer
CLEAR CAP BOTTLE - 1X Elution Buffer (Dilute prior to use as described in the Reagent Preparation section)

User Supplied
Agencourt AMPure XP Magnetic Beads (room temperature)
Isopropanol
80% Ethanol
Nuclease-free 1.7 mL microcentrifuge tubes
Spin-X Centrifuge tube (Sigma)
Sterile disposable pestles (Fisher Cat # K749521-1500 or similar)
Magnetic stand for micrcentrifuge tubes (Life Technologies DynaMag™-2 or similar)
*Gel Slice (in 1.7 mL tube) (from section "Gel Electrophoresis")
source_data.thread_text:
Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
YELLOW CAP - Resuspension Buffer
CLEAR CAP BOTTLE - 1X Elution Buffer (Dilute prior to use as described in the Reagent Preparation section)

User Supplied
Agencourt AMPure XP Magnetic Beads (room temperature)
Isopropanol
80% Ethanol
Nuclease-free 1.7 mL microcentrifuge tubes
Spin-X Centrifuge tube (Sigma)
Sterile disposable pestles (Fisher Cat # K749521-1500 or similar)
Magnetic stand for micrcentrifuge tubes (Life Technologies DynaMag™-2 or similar)
*Gel Slice (in 1.7 mL tube) (from section "Gel Electrophoresis")
source_data.body:
Materials

Bioo Scientific Supplied
YELLOW CAP - Resuspension Buffer
CLEAR CAP BOTTLE - 1X Elution Buffer (Dilute prior to use as described in the Reagent Preparation section)

User Supplied
Agencourt AMPure XP Magnetic Beads (room temperature)
Isopropanol
80% Ethanol
Nuclease-free 1.7 mL microcentrifuge tubes
Spin-X Centrifuge tube (Sigma)
Sterile disposable pestles (Fisher Cat # K749521-1500 or similar)
Magnetic stand for micrcentrifuge tubes (Life Technologies DynaMag™-2 or similar)
*Gel Slice (in 1.7 mL tube) (from section "Gel Electrophoresis")

components.data: Crush the gel slice thoroughly with a disposable pestle. Leave the pestle in the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Crush the gel slice thoroughly with a disposable pestle. Leave the pestle in the tube.

components.data: Add 300 µL of Elution Buffer to each tube and then remove the pestle, ensuring that as much gel as possible has been washed from the pestle.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 300 µL of Elution Buffer to each tube and then remove the pestle, ensuring that as much gel as possible has been washed from the pestle.

components.data: Let gel pieces soak at least 2 hours or overnight at room temperature with agitation. DO NOT incubate longer than overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let gel pieces soak at least 2 hours or overnight at room temperature with agitation. DO NOT incubate longer than overnight.

components.data: Pulse spin tubes to collect all eluate from wall and lid.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pulse spin tubes to collect all eluate from wall and lid.

components.data:
Carefully transfer the eluate (including crushed gel) to the top of a Spin-X Centrifuge
tube (Sigma). Cutting the end off of a P1000 tip can help in transfer of larger gel pieces.
Centrifuge the Spin-X tube at 16,000 x g for 2 minutes. Dispose of the spin filter.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Carefully transfer the eluate (including crushed gel) to the top of a Spin-X Centrifuge
tube (Sigma). Cutting the end off of a P1000 tip can help in transfer of larger gel pieces.
Centrifuge the Spin-X tube at 16,000 x g for 2 minutes. Dispose of the spin filter.

components.data:
Add to each tube and mix well*:

50 µL AMPure XP Beads
350 µL Isopropanol
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add to each tube and mix well*:

50 µL AMPure XP Beads
350 µL Isopropanol

components.data: Incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes. Agitation during this incubation may increase efficiency of recovery.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes. Agitation during this incubation may increase efficiency of recovery.

components.data: Magnetize sample until solution appears clear.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Magnetize sample until solution appears clear.

components.data: Wash #1: Carefully remove and discard the supernatant, add 950 µL 80% ethanol, incubate 30 seconds, and remove.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #1: Carefully remove and discard the supernatant, add 950 µL 80% ethanol, incubate 30 seconds, and remove.

components.data: Wash #2: Carefully remove and discard the supernatant, add 950 µL 80% ethanol, incubate 30 seconds, and remove.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash #2: Carefully remove and discard the supernatant, add 950 µL 80% ethanol, incubate 30 seconds, and remove.

components.data:
Dry sample for 3 minutes. After one minute, remove all residual liquid that may have
collected at the bottom of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Dry sample for 3 minutes. After one minute, remove all residual liquid that may have
collected at the bottom of the tube.

components.data: Remove plate from magnetic rack and resuspend bead pellet in 13 µL of Resuspension Buffer by pipetting volume up and down. Ensure that beads are completely resuspended and rehydrated.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove plate from magnetic rack and resuspend bead pellet in 13 µL of Resuspension Buffer by pipetting volume up and down. Ensure that beads are completely resuspended and rehydrated.
Incubate for 2 minutes.

components.data: Magnetize for 5 minutes or until supernatant appears clear.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Magnetize for 5 minutes or until supernatant appears clear.

components.data: Transfer 12 µL of supernatant to a clean 1.7 mL tube. This is your sequencing library.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer 12 µL of supernatant to a clean 1.7 mL tube. This is your sequencing library.

components.data:
Check the size distribution and concentration of the final library by Bioanalyzer High
Sensitivity DNA Assay (Agilent).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Check the size distribution and concentration of the final library by Bioanalyzer High
Sensitivity DNA Assay (Agilent).

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 79 of NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.protocol_name_html: NEXTflex™ Small RNA Sequencing for Total RNA Starting Material
source_data.annotation: If desired, ethanol precipiatation or other nucleic acid purification methods may be used for purification of supernatant after this step. For ethanol precipitation, it is recommended to transfer eluate from this step to a clean microcentrifuge tube, as pellets can be difficult to handle in the Spin-X tubes.
source_data.thread_text: If desired, ethanol precipiatation or other nucleic acid purification methods may be used for purification of supernatant after this step. For ethanol precipitation, it is recommended to transfer eluate from this step to a clean microcentrifuge tube, as pellets can be difficult to handle in the Spin-X tubes.
source_data.body: If desired, ethanol precipiatation or other nucleic acid purification methods may be used for purification of supernatant after this step. For ethanol precipitation, it is recommended to transfer eluate from this step to a clean microcentrifuge tube, as pellets can be difficult to handle in the Spin-X tubes.
